name: Independent Community Engaged Research
description: A placement-based course in which students gain experience and develop social research and professional skills working on projects initiated by community partners. The accompanying seminar reviews conventional and creative interdisciplinary research methodologies relevant to the social purpose sector while supporting studentsâ€™ participatory- and reflective learning. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
prerequisites: Completion of a minimum of 9.0 FCE and successful completion of the application process.
